#summary Terminal program used to develop and debug PropForth

http://ttssh2.sourceforge.jp/

Versions of teraterm used in testing:

 4.67

 4.65

 4.63

Install using all defaults

Change the following parameters to use TeraTerm to access the standard PropForth interactive command prompt over the serial (comport) connection: 

  Setup - > Terminal -> New-Line receive CR+LF (PropForth 3.6 and later should use default CR)

  Setup - > Terminal -> New-Line Transmit CR 

  Setup - > Terminal -> Terminal ID VT100

 Setup - > Terminal -> Local Echo UNCHECKED

 Setup - > Terminal -> Auto Switch Checked 

 Setup - > Terminal -> Answer back - blank 

 Setup - > Serial Port Setup  -> Port COMx (what ever PropTool says when it finds your prop)

 Setup - > Serial Port Setup  -> Baud Rate 57600

 Setup - > Serial Port Setup  -> Data - 8 BIT

 Setup - > Serial Port Setup  -> PArity - none 

 Setup - > Serial Port Setup  -> Stop - 1 bit

 Setup - > Serial Port Setup  -> Flow Control -none 

 Setup - > Serial Port Setup  -> Transmit Dely -> 0 msec/char

 Setup - > Serial Port Setup  -> Transmit Dely -> 0 msec/line 

 Setup - > General Setup  -> Default Port -> COMx (what ever PropTool says when it finds your prop)

 Setup - > Serial Port Setup  -> Additional Settings -> Visual (TAB) -> Enable ANSI color CHECKED (if you wish to use the ANSI.f for colorful text on the serial port)

 Setup - > Save Setup  -> TERATERM.INI -> SAVE (this will cause the above to be applied each time you start teraterm)


To use TeraTerm to access a Telnet Session over Ethernet:

 Setup - > TCP/IP -> Host List -> enter the target IP address -> ADD

 Setup - > TCP/IP -> Telnet CHECKED

 Setup - > TCP/IP -> Port 23

 Setup - > TCP/IP -> Term type xterm

 Setup - > General -> Default Port -> TCP/IP 
 
 Setup - > Save Setup  -> TERATERM.INI -> SAVE (teraterm starts a telnet session)

I tend to switch between telnet and serial, its not hard to do an keep track of after a while.
